function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Spread of misinformation regarding the use of anti-inflammatory drugs in relation to COVID-19 treatment","Impact":"Increased risk of individuals self-medicating in a way that worsens the infection or their condition","Mitigation":"Public health campaigns to clarify and correct misinformation, and encouraging people to seek advice from medical professionals","Technologies":"Social media monitoring and fact-checking tools","People":"General public, individuals with COVID-19 symptoms","Owner":"Health authorities, medical professionals, social media platforms"},{"Description":"Lack of evidence-based research on the recommended use of anti-inflammatory drugs for COVID-19 treatment","Impact":"Uncertainty and confusion among medical professionals and the general public regarding the most effective treatment options","Mitigation":"Investment in research and clinical trials to provide clear guidance on the use of anti-inflammatory drugs for COVID-19","Technologies":"Biomedical databases, clinical research tools","People":"Medical researchers, healthcare providers, patients","Owner":"Research institutions, healthcare organizations, pharmaceutical companies"},{"Description":"Reliance on expert opinions without sufficient scientific evidence","Impact":"Potential for incorrect or misleading advice to be disseminated and followed by a large audience","Mitigation":"Promotion of evidence-based medicine and critical appraisal of expert opinions before widespread dissemination","Technologies":"Peer-reviewed journals, scientific evaluation frameworks","People":"Medical professionals, researchers, organizations advocating for public health","Owner":"Scientific and medical communities"}]}
